repnme.cdata!:
Jamaica - Private Sector Development
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Private Sector
            Development Adjustment Loan Project for Jamaica were as
            follows: outcomes were highly satisfactory, the project
            sustainability was likely, the Bank performance was highly
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also highly
            satisfactory. One of the main lessons learned from the loan
            is that a key element for the success of any major
            adjustment program is strong ownership on the part of the
            government. In this regard, the program of reform should
            build strongly on the Policy Framework agreed with the
            government. Strong ownership ensures strong commitment to
            the reform and minimizes the risk of reversal, particularly
            in the face of politically unpopular reforms. Another key
            lesson learned is that the Bank should appraise carefully
            not only a Government's commitment to a reform program,
            but also its institutional capacity to implement it. This
            will assist the Bank and borrowers to identify weaknesses
            early on and facilitate either the prerequisite or companion
            technical assistance to build implementation capacity. In
            particular, the Bank should assess very carefully the scope
            of actions to be carried out under a project to establish a
            realistic time-frame for the completion.

5079460.owner: Office of the Regional Vice Pres (EAPVP)
5079460.majtheme: Public sector governance,Rural development,Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Jamaica - Private Sector Development
            Adjustment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Private Sector Development
            Adjustment Loan Project will support the government's
            program to achieve rapid and sustained growth through
            private sector development.  Macroeconomic policies will
            primarily focus on strengthening fiscal adjustment.  Trade
            reform will reduce tariff protection in stages in accordance
            with the recently agreed Caribbean Community Common External
            Tariff, increasing international competitiveness and
            efficiency of enterprises.  The privatization program, which
            cuts across many sectors, will open new activities for the
            private sector, shift the government's role from
            commercial and industrial activities to the social sectors
            and reduce the fiscal burden of inefficient public
            enterprises.  Complementary legal, regulatory and
            administrative reforms will improve the business environment
            to accelerate output and export response. The loan will
            finance general imports, subject to certain restrictions.

Jamaica - Private Sector Development
